abwarten.notes: to wait - needs practice with preposition usage

beachten.notes: to notice, to pay attention to - takes direct accusative object, no 'auf'

aufgeben.notes: to give up - good understanding of separable verb usage

entscheiden.notes: to decide - review reflexive form with 'f端r' + accusative

vorschlagen.notes: to suggest - minor issues with modal perfect conjugation

sich interessieren f端r.notes: to be interested in - good usage with correct preposition

warten auf.notes: to wait for - great understanding and usage

denken an.notes: to think about - needs practice with first person conjugation

sich freuen auf.notes: to look forward to - good structure but needs practice with possessive articles

teilnehmen an.notes: to participate in - multiple issues with separable verb structure and dative case

Modal verbs with perfect tense.notes: Good understanding of double infinitive structure, minor issues with 'd端rfen' spelling and 3rd person conjugation

Two-way prepositions with dative/accusat.notes: Good understanding of the wo/wohin distinction with two-way prepositions

Verb-preposition combinations.notes: Mixed results - strong with some combinations, needs practice with separable verbs and case requirements

Separable verbs (trennbare Verben).notes: Needs practice with word order and conjugation of separable verbs

session_history.notes: First session with randomly selected vocabulary and grammar topics

session_history.focus: Modal verbs with perfect tense, Two-way prepositions
session_history.notes: Strong with two-way prepositions, good with double infinitive structure. Issues with verb-preposition combinations.
Good with basic combinations, needs work on separable verbs and article/case systems
